content:
First, I am not a mac user. Some suggestions: - you can install a new copy of the same version of thunderbird directly over the top of current install. You can locate and download the desired version and language here: https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/ - if you want to save your data for a move to new computer, you need a copy of the profile folder. Here are possible steps:

  1. click help>troubleshootinginformation
  2. scroll to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder
  3. exit thunderbird here. important
  4. you are now in the profile, back up at least one folder so that you can do a full copy of the profile.
  5. on new PC, in thunderbird, click tools>impoort.>import from another thunderbird installation
creator: davidsk

content:
Thanks for your reply. I have attached an image and will use it to explain the issue. The image is of Thunderbird on my laptop.

I went to the list of mail folders in the left most panel, right clicked, and created folder "Mozilla". You can see it now in the image circled at the very bottom of that left panel.

That folder is the issue. I was not able to create it as an imap folder. To illustrate that, I then copied your email to that folder and selected the folder with that one entry. I then clicked on the email to move it to another folder and that is when I took this screenshot.

As you can see, when I navigate to my email name I see a partial list of folders (compared to the left panel). I also see "[Gmail]" as a slide off and that is the final list on the right. Those are imap folders, not local, and available to any instance of Thunderbird I may run on a phone, my desktop systems, etc.

There used to be a way to see that "[Gmail]" option in the list of folders on the left side so that I had the option of creating a local or an imap folder. Now that option is either gone or hidden.

I hope that description and the image help describe what I am trying to report. ;-)

To be fair, it is possible that all the folders are now imap'd. Maybe I'm misunderstanding that it is working okay and that the interface got smoothed out but I still need to know what, if any, difference there is between what look like two independent sets of folders.

content:
Dit kan toeval zijn en op een probleem bij uw provider wijzen, maar het kan ook zijn dat uw inbox-bestand beschadigd is. Als het probleem zich niet binnen korte tijd vanzelf oplost, probeer dan de oplossing in https://www.bitrecover.com/blog/thunderbird-uid-fetch-server-error/ (opnieuw opbouwen inbox.msf).

Let op: controleer voordat u het bovenstaande doet of er niet toevallig sprake is van een virus- of malwarebesmetting door uw antivirusprogramma een grondige scan uit te laten voeren.

content:
Prova a dettagliare la tua configurazione:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content:
Buongiorno !

  • La versione di Thunderbird è 128.8.1esr (64bit)
  • Il sistema operativo è windows 11pro
  • provider yahoo
  • account imap
  • estensioni nessuna
  • non ci sono msg di errore

In realtà il problema è emerso da quando ho cambiato i parametri. Prima avevo imap.mail.yahoo.com, adesso ho export.imap.mail.yahoo.com Prima non sincronizzavo fra server e Thunderbird. Adesso, con i nuovi parametri, se cancello da Thunderbird, cancello da server yahoo Prima avevo lo stesso problema, ossia all'apertura di Thunderbird non andava sulla posta in arrivo ma sull'account. Un amico mi aveva trovato la soluzione come segue:

"apri esplora risorse e incolla il seguente link: %APPDATA%\Thunderbird\Profiles premi invio trova il file session.json.backup (in fondo) tast dx proprietà e imposta come sola lettura"

In questo modo andavo direttamente sulla posta in arrivo. Con il cambio dei parametri imap di cui sopra, anche se il file session è di sola lettura, appena apro Thunderbird va sull'account e non sulla posta in arrivo.
creator: nico.loschiavo

content:
Sinceramente stai mettendo assieme troppe cose diverse.

La procedura che citi session.json.backup la trovi descritta meglio qui -> https://forum.mozillaitalia.org/index.php?topic=72487.msg514187#msg514187 ma funziona se hai una sola scheda aperta. Tu lasci altre schede aperte?

La questione IMAP, sinceramente non ho idea da dove tu abbia preso il server export.imap.mail.yahoo.com, quelli suggeriti da Yahoo li trovi qui -> https://it.aiuto.yahoo.com/kb/SLN4075.html Il server che stai utilizzando ha uno scopo diverso, vale a dire generare una copia di backup delle tue mail -> https://it.aiuto.yahoo.com/kb/SLN28681.html

A prescindere da questo, se usi IMAP la posta è sempre sincronizzata.

Per il resto, le mie abitudini non sono cambiate. Non lasciavo una scheda aperta prima. Non la lascio adesso. Non riesco a spiegarmi perchè, all'apertura di Thunderbird, non vada dunque in posta in arrivo ma in account yahoo come ho mostrato dallo screen-shot. Riesci ad aiutarmi ? Ripeto, mi spiace per la confusione. Pensavo che le cose fossero collegate

content:
Thank you for the follow-up, David.

In order to subscribe to an individual folder, I right-click on my e-mail address at the top of the left-hand column and select Subscribe (or do File > Subscribe); select a folder in the list that is displayed; and click on OK. If I then exit from Thunderbird and restart, the selected folder appears in the left-hand column. That works, whether or not the box is checked for 'Show only subscribed folders'. What I don't understand is why it's necessary to do that after the 'Show only subscribed folders' box has been unchecked.

I have tried (1) unchecking the 'Show only subscribed folders' box, exiting and restarting; (2) deleting my account and creating a new one with the box unchecked at the start; and (3) deleting my account, exiting, deleting the profile directory under AppData\Roaming\thunderbird\, restarting, and creating a new account with the box unchecked at the start. The unsubscribed folders still don't appear.

Edit: I don't see anything that says 'All folders' and 'Subscribe'. I should also say that, although this thread mentioned subfolders at the start, my concern is with folders that don't appear, not just subfolders.

Edit 2: All of the above was done with Thunderbird 136.0.1 under Windows 11 Home. I've now installed Thunderbird 128.8.0esr under Debian 12.10. Once again, unchecking 'Show only subscribed folders' does not result in all folders being displayed.

content: To get Thunderbird to fetch all your folders, including Sent, Spam, and subfolders, right-click on your account name and select "Subscribe." Then, check the boxes for all the folders you want to sync. Make sure the option "Keep messages for this account on this computer" is enabled under "Tools > Account Settings > Synchronization & Storage." Additionally, you can right-click on specific folders like Sent or Spam and choose "Synchronize" to force a manual sync. Finally, verify your IMAP settings under "Tools > Account Settings > Server Settings" to ensure everything is configured correctly. These steps should allow Thunderbird to download all your emails and folders.
